intro: Chamaefistula hemicardia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved boxwood, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Buxaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically a deep green color. It is often used in horticulture for its ability to form neat, decorative shapes. Chamaefistula hemicardia is relatively low-maintenance and thrives in well-drained soils.
